snippet: The Manhattan district attorney’s office is using a sex trafficking law to redefine its approach, treating women who work for ringleaders as victims and not criminals.
abstract: Manhattan district attorney’s office is using a sex trafficking charge, added to the New York State penal code in 2007, that is helping redefine its approach to prostitution cases; women working as prostitutes are not facing criminal charges but are instead being treated as pimps' victims and are offered services to help them build new lives.
lead_paragraph: The Manhattan district attorney’s office is using a sex trafficking law to redefine its approach, treating women who work for ringleaders as victims and not criminals.

headline.seo: Manhattan Prosecutors Focus on Pimps Instead of Prostitutes
headline.main: Prosecutors Focus on Pimps and Clients, Instead of Prostitutes
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors Shift Focus On Charges In Sex Cases
